58 years ago the Friendship 9 made history as one of the first groups to sit-in at a Whites-Only lunch counter. 

Rather than pay bail they chose to spend 30 days in jail, sparking the Jail, No Bail movement.

Today we remember them, their bravery & the mark they made in history. pic.twitter.com/mtvQNU1xlI

Jackie Robinson would have been 100 years old today.

He not only broke the baseball color barrier but also played an important role as a catalyst for the civil rights movement.

Today, we remember his tremendous legacy and its lasting impacts. pic.twitter.com/8EbVJTIZMt

Today, I joined @HouseDemocrats in support of the #PaycheckFairnessAct. 

Women and men doing the same work deserve the same pay. Plain and simple. #EqualPay pic.twitter.com/xVKt8G5ejn

We have made significant progress towards the restoration and preservation of historic buildings and sites on the campuses of HBCUs, but there is still much more that needs to be done. 

By continuing these efforts, we are extending a tremendous legacy.  https://www.majoritywhip.gov/index.cfm?p=PressReleases&ContentRecord_id=A503389F-B62C-409D-A298-0DE44FC2801E&ContentType_id=6E8988A5-6FAE-4E56-A2FA-E97BB091098C …

Thankful for the leadership of the Network of Jewish Human Service Agencies & @theJCPA as we fight against discrimination in our child welfare system. A child ought not be kept from a loving home because of religious differences.

Social Security isn't an 'entitlement.' 

It's the insurance hard-working Americans have paid for with every paycheck. 

The Social Security 2100 Act ensures this earned benefit will be available for the current generation of retirees and the generations to come. #Secure2100

“Current practices and policies at our Southern border wrought inexcusable injustices throughout our country that cry out for just and merciful solutions.” https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/lawmaker-news/427307-border-security-that-is-smart-just-and-merciful?rnd=1548741699 …

It’s been 10 years since the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act was signed into law, yet women are still being paid less than men for the same work. 

As the father of 3 daughters, I believe closing the pay gap is long overdue.
Remembering my good friend and Lake City, SC native Ron McNair today. This trailblazing astronaut gave us all hope that we, too, could reach for the stars. #Challenger

This tax hike on places of worship and nonprofits is one of many inexcusable consequences of the GOP tax scam. 

In the coming days, I’ll be reintroducing the Stop the Tax Hike on Charities and Places of Worship Act to reverse this unfair burden. https://www.postandcourier.com/news/percent-federal-tax-on-church-nonprofit-parking-spaces-creating-confusion/article_4b6fbbdc-1f2f-11e9-885d-3b854a868d7c.html …

As we remember those events today, we must also remember that to remain silent is to be complacent.
#HolocaustMemorialDay pic.twitter.com/xwX9s4fMcX

Today the American people’s and federal workers’ prayers are answered. 

I am pleased an agreement has been reached that will reopen the government. 

I am very hopeful that Congress will use the time provided by this plan to find common ground on a path forward.”

This #TrumpShutdown is threatening millions of Americans’ safety.

We cannot demand that our air traffic controllers & other federal employees keep working for free while this president continues to throw a temper tantrum over an ineffective border wall. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/flights-laguardia-delayed-due-air-traffic-control-staff-shortage-n962686 …

Day 35 of the #TrumpShutdown.

Another paycheck missed by federal workers.

Federal workers should not continue to be held hostage over this irresponsible border wall. 

We must #EndTheShutdown now!

This #TrumpShutdown is putting millions of Americans’ safety at risk. 

Our air traffic controllers, TSA agents, safety inspectors, FBI agents, and other federal workers cannot continue to work without pay. 

We must #EndTheShutdown now! http://time.com/5511886/air-traffic-controllers-shutdown-warning/ …

This morning, @realDonaldTrump’s Secretary of Commerce, Wilbur Ross, said he didn’t understand why federal workers need to go to food banks. 

This is why. https://www.cnn.com/2019/01/23/politics/the-shutdown-is-hurting-some-federal-workers/index.html …

The House has done its job to end this shutdown 10 TIMES! 

It’s time for the Senate and the president to do theirs. https://www.politico.com/story/2019/01/24/senate-rejects-trump-plan-to-fund-border-wall-and-end-shutdown-1124728 …

What we’re trying to do is come to a conclusion on how best to secure the border efficiently, effectively, and humanely, but we must reopen the government first. (via @NewDay) pic.twitter.com/wPTi8WJvx2

The president cannot continue to hold federal workers hostage while he throws a temper tantrum over his ineffective border wall. 

We need smart border security, not a concrete edifice. 

We must #EndTheShutdown.

55 years ago, the 24th amendment was ratified, eliminating poll taxes.
 
Yet we are still seeing evidence of poll taxes today in the form of voter ID laws.
 
In a democracy such as ours, we must not have any impediments to voting. pic.twitter.com/CHdsmmcZfQ

The House voted to end this #TrumpShutdown AGAIN today. 

House Democrats continue to do their part to end this irresponsible shutdown, it’s time for @senatemajldr and @realdonaldtrump to do theirs.

The #TransMilitaryBan has no place in our country. 

How we can ban people from fighting for the very freedoms the military is charged with protecting?

To the thousands of trans troops and their families currently serving, please know that we will keep fighting for you.

Today is the 46th anniversary of #RoevWade, where @SCOTUS made the landmark decision recognizing that women have the right to make their own health decisions. 

We must keep fighting to protect women’s rights so that they can continue to have access to reproductive health care.

Harris Wofford lived a lifetime of committed advocacy for social justice, and his many contributions significantly helped advance our country’s mission of forming a “more perfect Union.”  May he rest in peace.

We ought to see what is effective, what is efficient, and what the experts say will work to secure the border. 

We need border security, not a concrete edifice to anybody’s existence. (via @KasieDC) pic.twitter.com/sJN5T5VgII

Then we can discuss a solution that provides Dreamers and TPS recipients long-term protections and supports border security through improved infrastructure and manpower at ports of entry and smart technology like drones, radars and sensors.

Democrats have voted nine times to reopen the government and these bills are awaiting action by Senate Leader McConnell. Enact one of these measures, which have previously received bipartisan support, and open the government immediately.

Until the President releases his hostages – federal workers and the American people – there will be no negotiation. End the shutdown now, and we can consider how a compromise giving lasting protections for Dreamers and TPS recipients may lead to a deal on border security.

We have been in this #TrumpShutdown for 28 days. 

Time and time again, House Democrats have passed legislation to reopen the government, yet Senator McConnell refuses to allow a vote on the legislation. 

This has gone on long enough. #EndTheShutdown
Happy birthday my friend. https://twitter.com/OversightDems/status/1086257757978849280 …
Wishing @MichelleObama a very Happy Birthday today. May you continue to be a beacon of light in this nation and an inspiration for girls all around the world.

So what can kind of lines and security concerns can travelers expect during the #SuperBowl?

As a former history teacher, I’m glad I could drop some knowledge today. Look forward to learning more from you about this thing called Twitter.

There's no place in America where a full-time worker can make ends meet on the federal minimum wage of $7.25/hour. The #RaiseTheWageAct would raise wages for nearly 40 million Americans by gradually increasing the minimum wage to $15/hour. 

Americans deserve a livable wage. pic.twitter.com/Slgx45G3el

Now is the time to do right. 

We have reached a tipping point. Racial divisiveness is a fault line that is ripping our nation apart. This body must speak out against this evil. 

The time has come to condemn those of ill will and say they have no part in our great nation.
Proud to be working with Coast Guard Commandant, Admiral Karl Schultz on legislation that will ensure pay for active duty Coast Guard personnel while the federal government is shut down.

Or people like Mr. Sederstrom, a 26-year Coast Guard veteran who doesn’t know whether or not he’ll get his retirement check if this shutdown extends into February.

This shutdown has gone on long enough. 

#EndTheShutdown now.
People like Ms. Hays, a single mother of 3 and senior correctional officer who can’t feed her children because this president is holding her paycheck hostage over a medieval border wall.

Today I denounce the words of Representative Steve King, and I do so invoking the words of another King, Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. who, if he had been allowed to live, would be celebrating his 90th birthday on tomorrow.

"We are going to be made to repent, not just for the hateful words and deeds of bad people, but for the appalling silence of good people." 

It is time for other good Republicans to break their silence on the hateful words of Congressman Steve King.
I applaud my fellow South Carolinian, Senator Tim Scott, for taking to heart Martin Luther King, Jr’s counsel in his letter from the Birmingham City Jail that said;

The #TrumpShutdown is the longest government shutdown in history. 

This president must stop holding federal workers hostage with his temper tantrum over a medieval border wall. #TrumpShutdown

Enough is enough. #EndTheShutdown now! pic.twitter.com/NXK2oOrxEE

The House has done its job to end this shutdown and pay federal workers. 

It’s time for the Senate and the president to do the same. 

#EndTheShutdown

Federal workers should not be used as pawns in the president’s attempt to secure a medieval, ineffective border wall. 

This has gone on long enough.

It’s time to end this #TrumpShutdown. https://www.cnn.com/2019/01/11/politics/shutdown-paycheck-what-it-looks-like-trnd/index.html …
Not paying federal workers is not an American value. pic.twitter.com/ynXW9CciQa

The government has been shut down for 18 days.  

On day 1 of the 116th Congress, the House passed a complete funding package that Leader McConnell has refused to bring up for a Senate vote.

Enough is enough. 

End this #TrumpShutdown.
All of these bills passed last Congress with overwhelming bipartisan support and should be passed again so these hard-working Americans can get paid and critical services can resume.

This week, House Democrats are pushing individual appropriations bill to re-open the government: 

-Department of the Treasury and the IRS
-Department of Agriculture
-Department of the Interior 
-Department of Housing and Urban Development

Last year, nearly 40,000 Americans died because of gun violence. 

Gun violence has become an epidemic in our country and needs to be addressed immediately. #NeverAgain
Today, House Democrats are introducing legislation on universal gun background checks so we can prevent tragedies like this from happening again.
Today marks the 8th anniversary of the mass shooting in Tucson, AZ where 6 innocent lives were lost & over a dozen more were left injured, including my good friend, former Rep. Gabby Giffords.

It’s time to end this unnecessary shutdown. pic.twitter.com/Bse7e5F5OG

The American people ought not be the president’s hostages over his ill-advised and ill-defined border wall. 

It is time for the Senate to do its part to reopen the government and tell this president that enough is enough.
